polished_script:
HOOK: A $50 million producer just said something that stopped me cold. [ON-SCREEN: $50M PRODUCER]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You know that feeling when your phone rings at 9 PM and you hesitate before answering? When client calls start feeling like interruptions instead of opportunities? [ON-SCREEN: 9 PM PHONE CALL] When you've been grinding so long that every lead feels like just another transaction to close? You're not alone â€” most agents hit this wall around year three. [ON-SCREEN: YEAR 3 BURNOUT]

[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what separates the agents who burn out from the ones who build empires.

INSIGHT: Kristee Leonard â€” 18 years in luxury real estate, still answers every call like it's her first day. [ON-SCREEN: 18 YEARS EXPERIENCE] Here's exactly what she told me: "I don't take that for granted... for someone to choose you, it is an honor." [ON-SCREEN: "IT IS AN HONOR"] Not a transaction. Not a commission check. An honor. And here's how it shows up: When Zillow transfers a lead to her, she doesn't introduce herself first â€” she asks when they want to see the house. [ON-SCREEN: SKIP THE INTRO] Because they already chose her. Most agents forget this â€” they start seeing clients as interruptions. [ON-SCREEN: INTERRUPTION VS HONOR] Top producers like Kristee see them as the reason they still get to do this work.

REFRAME: Every person who calls you passed on dozens of other agents. They didn't choose your brokerage â€” they chose you. That's not pressure, that's privilege. You can shift this mindset today.

CTA: "When's the last time you answered the phone like it was an honor â€” yes or no?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. Pause dramatically after "stopped me cold" in the hook â€” let the curiosity build
2. Emphasize "HONOR" both times with genuine reverence, not just volume
3. Maintain direct eye contact during the reframe section â€” this is the transformation moment
